name: Black Lotus
description: Iconic Alpha rare artifact. Adds three mana of any color to your mana pool, then is sacrificed. One of the most valuable MTG cards in existence.

name: Jace, the Mind Sculptor
description: Powerful planeswalker with four versatile abilities including card manipulation, bouncing creatures, and milling. Considered one of the strongest planeswalkers ever printed.

name: Tarmogoyf
description: Legendary Modern staple creature whose power and toughness are equal to the number of card types in all graveyards. Often a very efficient threat for its mana cost.

name: Force of Will
description: Classic blue counterspell that can be cast for free by exiling a blue card from your hand and paying 1 life. Essential in Legacy and Vintage formats.

name: Liliana of the Veil
description: Powerful black planeswalker that forces all players to discard, can remove creatures, and can separate permanents into two piles for sacrifice. Format staple in Modern.

name: Mox Sapphire
description: Part of the Power Nine, this zero-cost artifact taps to add blue mana to your mana pool. Reserved List card with extreme rarity and value.

name: Uro, Titan of Nature's Wrath
description: Powerful Simic (Green/Blue) Elder Giant that gains life, draws cards, and ramps lands. Can escape from your graveyard for continued value.

name: Mishra's Workshop
description: Legendary land that taps for three colorless mana that can only be spent on artifact spells. Reserved List card and Vintage staple.
